content.protection: Draws. Shares anchor with Monkey Balls
content.location: Left and more moderate variation next to Monkey Balls. This route shares the first several bolts with Monkey balls and then traverses left to more featured rock.

content.description: Great route following the prominent corner crack at the start of the wall. Be ready for everything from slab moves to off-width.
content.location: near start of wall (see topo photo)

content.description: Bolted slab leads to an inside corner crack and vertical face.
content.protection:
bolts, can place a variety of gear in upper crack.

finger to 4" size range. chains on top.
content.location: right most route in the ball park area....(which is the right most area of the balls wall)

content.description: Steep, open-handed climbing that follows unique features through orange and grey streaked granite.
content.protection: Draws. There are chains on ledge where rock angle eases to slab.
content.location: Left end of the balls wall. The route follows the right variation of the two bolt lines through the steepest portion of the wall.

content.description: Excellent route through a crux bulge then following face moves and fun pockets on the left side of an exposed arete. Great features and excellent position. May be grade or two harder for those under 6' tall!
content.location: Center of wall. Look for a path leading to a small belay platform. Bolts start up a slab to crux bulge.

content.description: A finger and toe intensive climb in an airy position. Start up the low angle ledges and seams directly under the arete to the right of money ball. Steep crimping leads to an awkward sequence to stand on the slabby right side of the arete. Enjoy the dime edges to the top.
content.protection: 31 meters long! 18 bolts to the chain anchor which is shared with Money Ball.
content.location: The long line of bolts up the arete and face to the right of money ball. BE AWARE THAT A 60 METER ROPE MAY NOT REACH BACK TO THE BASE OF THE ROUTE!! It is easy to swing left up slope to the base of money ball to reduce chances of being lowered off the end of the rope!

content.description: harder than it looks face/slab route
content.protection: bolts to chains below top of wall
content.location: center of ballpark (right side of balls wall)

content.description: Fun water streaked slab to an awkward inside corner/roof. Insecure slab exit left.
content.location: West facing wall on the far left end of the central balls wall. steep vegetated gash to the left divides central wall from left wall.

content.description: Fun slab moves past a bolt lead to a beautiful finger crack on the upper portion. Definitely fun and a great intro to the area.
content.protection: Draws and gear to 2". chain anchor shared with un-ball-ievable
content.location: On the face just to the right of the striking inside corner as you approach the main wall. The route starts the same as un-ball-ievable, which climbs the striking right-facing corner.

content.description: Super fun climbing through a large, juggy, horizontal roof then up a clean shallow corner. Fantastic climb.
content.protection: Mixed gear and bolts. Gear to 2" Most people stick clip the first bolt. chain anchor 80 feet up on a small ledge stance.
content.location: Far Left end of Wall. Start in the cave where the packrat lives...
